org.lenskit.basic

Class TopNItemBasedItemRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lenskit.basic.AbstractItemBasedItemRecommender
      • org.lenskit.basic.TopNItemBasedItemRecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ItemBasedItemRecommender

    public class TopNItemBasedItemRecommender
extends AbstractItemBasedItemRecommender

    A global item recommender that recommends the top N items from a scorer.

    Since:
    1.1

    • Method Detail

      • recommendRelatedItemsWithDetails

        public ResultList recommendRelatedItemsWithDetails(Set<Long> basket,
                                                   int n,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Set<Long> candidates,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Set<Long> exclude)
        Description copied from interface: ItemBasedItemRecommender

        Produce a set of recommendations for the item, with details. This method functions identically to ItemBasedItemRecommender.recommendRelatedItems(Set, int, Set, Set), except that it returns more detailed results.

        Parameters:
        basket - The reference items.
        n - The number of ratings to return. If negative, recommend as many as possible.
        candidates - A set of candidate items which can be recommended. If null, all items are considered candidates.
        exclude - A set of items to be excluded. If null, a default exclude set is used.
        Returns:
        A list of recommended items with recommendation details. If the recommender cannot assign meaningful scores, the scores will be Double.NaN.

      • getDefaultExcludes

        protected LongSet getDefaultExcludes(LongSet items)

        Get the default exclude set for a item in the global recommendation. The base implementation returns the input set.

        Parameters:
        items - The items for which we are recommending.
        Returns:
        The set of items to exclude.

      • recommend

        protected ResultList recommend(int n,
                               ResultMap scores)

        Pick the top n items from a score vector.

        Parameters:
        n - The number of items to recommend.
        scores - The scored item vector.
        Returns:
        The top n items from scores, in descending order of score.
